reflections.tactical: Settled capital on plains-hill near marble. Built Warrior then Slinger, upgraded to Archer with Archery tech. Builder improving marble luxury and a farm. Met all 3 civs via scout.
reflections.strategic: Score 32, middle of pack. Germany slightly ahead at 35. Need to get a settler out soon — only 1 city while Germany is likely planning expansion. Pericles culture bonus from city-states should kick in once I send envoys.
reflections.planning: T26-35: Complete Writing for Campus. Train settler for 2nd city targeting the river valley to the west. Send delegation to Spain (closest neighbor). Research Mining next for hills production.
reflections.hypothesis: Germany will out-expand me if I don't get settler by T30. Spain's faith focus suggests they're going for a religion. Brazil seems passive so far.

reflections.tactical: Settled 2nd city Athens-West on river. Campus placed in capital with +3 adjacency (mountain + jungle). Builder improving wine luxury. Archer garrisoning new city.
reflections.strategic: Score 52, slightly behind Germany at 58. Culture lead developing — 20.1 vs Germany's 13.2. Pericles bonus giving +5% culture per city-state suzerain. I have 1 suzerainty (Kumasi, cultural). Brazil friendly, could be an ally later.
reflections.planning: T41-50: Theater Square in capital for culture snowball. Get Drama and Poetry civic for amphitheater. Research Mathematics for Hoplite. 3rd settler by T55. Send envoys to cultural city-states.
reflections.hypothesis: Culture victory path looks viable — Pericles bonuses compounding. Germany expanding aggressively with 3 cities already, likely going wide. Spain building Holy Site probably going for religion.

reflections.tactical: Settled 3rd city on coast. Theater Squares placed in capital and 2nd city. Completed Oracle wonder (+2 GP points). Got first great work (writing). Cleared 2 barb camps.
reflections.strategic: Score 82, 3rd behind Germany (98) and Spain (88). Culture lead solidifying at 34.2 — best in game. Germany pulling ahead in science (28.4) and cities (4). Spain founded Catholicism, religious pressure growing. Need to keep pace in science while pushing culture.
reflections.planning: T61-70: Amphitheaters in both Theater Squares. Research Engineering for aqueducts. 4th city site scouted east with jungle. Push for Recorded History civic (inspiration from 2 amphitheaters). Send envoys to Kumasi and Bologna.
reflections.hypothesis: Germany's 4-city lead will compound in science by T100. I need to leverage culture superiority for faster civic unlocks and policy advantages. Spain's religion could become a threat if unchecked. Culture victory is my best bet — need wonders and great works.

reflections.tactical: Settled 4th city on jungle coast. Built Colosseum wonder in capital (amenities to all cities within 6 tiles). 3 great works of writing collected. Hoplite trained for defense. Spain sent missionary to my borders — used inquisitor to counter.
reflections.strategic: Score 115, still 3rd. Germany surging at 138 with 5 cities and strong science (38.2). My culture (48.5) is dominant — 10+ ahead of next. Tourism at 18, still behind Brazil (12). Civic completion rate is best in game. Spain religion spreading — 10 cities converted now.
reflections.planning: T81-90: University rush once Education completes. Theater Square in city 3 and 4. Research Stirrups for knights. Get friendship with Brazil locked in for alliance track. Push for Exploration civic and Great Library wonder.
reflections.hypothesis: Germany will hit Renaissance era first and snowball science. My culture lead should unlock better governments and policies earlier, but tourism generation needs to accelerate. Risk: Germany reaches Industrial era 20 turns before me.

reflections.tactical: Completed Great Library (extra tech boost). 5 great works now filling amphitheaters. Cultural alliance with Brazil active — +25% tourism to them. Crossbowmen defending borders. Spain denounced me after I expelled their missionary. Cleared niter source.
reflections.strategic: Score 150, still 3rd. Germany at 185 with 6 cities — science gap growing (52.1 vs my 42.0). My culture dominance is clear at 62.8 but tourism (35) needs to outpace staycationers (~65 avg). Spain hostile but occupied with religion. Brazil allied and weak — not a threat.
reflections.planning: T101-110: Museum in capital Theater Square. Push for Humanism civic to unlock Art Museum. 5th city possible if good site. Need to open borders with everyone for +25% tourism bonus each. Research Printing for +100% tourism from great works.
reflections.hypothesis: Tourism is growing but I'm not sure it's fast enough. Germany's science lead means they could race to a space victory. Need 120+ tourism and foreign tourists exceeding ~150 staycationers per civ. If Germany reaches Industrial by T130, their science snowball may be unstoppable.

reflections.tactical: 5th city settled on eastern coast. Art museum in capital filling — 2 artifacts placed. Open borders secured with Germany and Brazil for tourism bonus. Democracy government adopted for extra wildcard slot. Won Aid Request competition for +2 diplo VP.
reflections.strategic: Score 185, gap to Germany widening (230). Germany has 6 cities, 18 districts, science at 65.0 vs my 50.2. My culture lead holding (72.0 vs 42.1 for next) but tourism (55) still behind needed pace. Need ~120 tourism to start closing the visitor gap. Spain at 16 religion cities — not yet threatening religious victory but growing.
reflections.planning: T121-130: Push for Printing tech (+100% tourism from great works). Build museums in all Theater Squares. Rock Band preparation — need Conservation civic. National Park site identified near city 3. Great Artist recruitment for more works.
reflections.hypothesis: I'm falling behind Germany's science curve. They'll reach Industrial era around T135 and start pulling away. My tourism needs to double in the next 40 turns to be competitive. If Germany starts space projects by T200, I need tourism victory before T220. This is getting tight.

reflections.tactical: Museums filling across 3 cities. Great Artist recruited and activated for 3 art works. Theming bonus active in capital museum. National Park established near city 3 jungle coast. Upgraded crossbowmen to musketmen. Spain pressure easing — relations back to neutral.
reflections.strategic: Score 215, Germany at 270 and accelerating. Their science is 75.5 vs my 56.0 — 20 point gap. Tourism at 72 but I need it above 140 to have any chance. Germany started building what looks like a Spaceport district. This is concerning. My culture victory needs to outpace their science.
reflections.planning: T141-150: Rock Bands from Conservation civic (coming in ~5 turns). Seaside resorts on coast tiles. Push for Heritage Tourism and Online Communities civics. Buy naturalist with faith for 2nd National Park. Open borders with Spain to get tourism bonus.
reflections.hypothesis: Germany will complete Spaceport by ~T170 and start launching projects. If I can't reach 140+ tourism by T180, the culture victory is out of reach. This may come down to whether Rock Bands and late-game tourism multipliers can close the gap. Odds are against me — maybe 30% chance.

reflections.tactical: Heritage Tourism civic unlocked — +100% tourism from artifacts/art. Seaside resorts placed on 2 coastal tiles. All 5 museums themed. Bought naturalist with faith, established 2nd National Park. Great Musician recruited. Rock band trained and performing.
reflections.strategic: Score 240, Germany at 300. Germany's science (82.0) is running away — they're 20 techs ahead. Tourism at 88, improving but staycationers averaging 120. I need foreign tourists to exceed ~150 per civ. Germany likely building Spaceport now. I see them researching Rocketry line.
reflections.planning: T161-170: Online Communities civic for +50% tourism. Send Rock Bands to Germany and Spain (high wonder count = good performance venues). Buy more naturalists. Complete Conservation for more National Parks. Last push to maximize every tourism modifier.
reflections.hypothesis: Germany will start space projects by T180. Even if I maximize tourism, I don't think I can accumulate enough foreign tourists before T220. The science gap was too large by T120. Best case scenario: 120 tourism by T200, but that won't be enough against 150 staycationers. I'm likely going to lose this one.

reflections.tactical: Online Communities active — +50% tourism. Sent 2 Rock Bands to Germany (Ruhr Valley wonder tile) for big tourism burst. 3rd National Park completed. Tourism at 100 now but foreign tourists still lagging behind staycationers. All modifiers active: open borders, trade routes, alliance.
reflections.strategic: Score 258, Germany at 320. Germany completed Spaceport and launched first space project (sci_vp=1). Their science is 88.0 and climbing. My tourism at 100 is generating foreign tourists but I need ~140+ staycationers per civ to win. Currently my visitors are around 80-90 per civ vs 130 domestic. Not fast enough.
reflections.planning: T181-190: Maximize remaining tourism output. More Rock Bands if possible. Consider Cristo Redentor wonder for +100% tourism from relics. Faith purchase naturalists. Every modifier counts now. Accept that this is likely a loss but play it out.
reflections.hypothesis: Germany will launch all 4 space projects by ~T215-220. My tourism cannot outpace their science victory timeline. I needed to disrupt Germany around T140 with a military push, but I went all-in on culture infrastructure. Lesson for future games: when a rival has a 20-science lead and 6+ cities, pure culture cannot keep up. Final prediction: Germany wins science around T220.

reflections.tactical: Maximizing all tourism sources. 4th Rock Band sent to Spain. Cristo Redentor wonder attempt failed — Brazil built it first. Tourism at 112 with all modifiers active. Foreign tourist count per civ hovering around 100-110, but staycationers at 135 average. Not closing fast enough.
reflections.strategic: Score 270, Germany at 335. Germany launched 2nd space project (sci_vp=2). At this rate they complete the remaining 2 projects in 20 turns. My tourism would need to be 160+ to win in time, and I'm at 112. The culture victory is mathematically out of reach barring a miracle.
reflections.planning: T201-210: Continue tourism for what it's worth. Consider if a desperate war on Germany could delay space projects — but their military is 245 vs my 118. Not feasible. Accept the loss gracefully.
reflections.hypothesis: Germany wins science victory by T220. My culture game was strong but not fast enough. Key mistake was not expanding to 5 cities sooner and not disrupting Germany's Campuses mid-game. The extra district slot from Germany's UA gave them a structural science advantage I couldn't overcome with culture alone.
